channel.title: [HELP] 'java' internal or external command
channel.description: wehn i run any .cmd that has to do with Java it says 'JAVA' is not a recongnized as an internal or external command, operable program file is a batch file. then it tells me to press any key to continue. waht do i do to fix this?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 07, 2008, 03:06:30 pm[/size][hr]any1? please answer!

item.title: [HELP] 'java' internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Zach_93 Zach 93
item.description:
@Zach_93 wrote:

Start>Control Panel>System>Advanced>Environmental Variables

Add one named CLASSPATH, and for the value put:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
Replacing "jdk1.6.0" with the one you have.

Add one named PATH, and for the value put:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin
Again, replacing jdk1.6.0 with the version you have.

Compiler:

@echo off
Title Compiler
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0\bin\javac.exe" *.java
pause

Again, replacig jdk1.6.0 with the version you have.

Read full topic

item.title: [HELP] 'java' internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Alpha_Evil Alpha Evil
item.description:
@Alpha_Evil wrote:

what i mean w[quote=“jensie, post:7, topic:224321”][quote author=Alpha Evil link=topic=294690.msg2372490#msg2372490 date=1218287489]
hmmmmmm… jensie, wut u mean Java files are not equal to batch files? does any1 autually have a solution to fix this?
[/quote]
Well, you said:

its not the compielr, its any Java .bat file i run. its annoying!

So I was attending you that there’s no Java.bat file…
You got:

  • Blablabla.java
  • Blablabla.class
  • compiler.bat

You see… Hell of a difference.[/quote]as a .bat file like run.bat that has to do with Java. not java.bat[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 09, 2008, 01:01:32 pm[/size][hr][quote=“chassy13, post:8, topic:224321”]make sure you have the right version of java, and that you set your classpaths[/quote]

okay. i made a classpath variable and i put this: CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_06\bin;%CLASSPATH%;

right?

item.title: [HELP] 'java' internal or external command
item.dc:creator: @Alpha_Evil Alpha Evil
item.description:
@Alpha_Evil wrote:

[quote=“Gh0st Jr, post:2, topic:224321”]just get new compiler.

if you right click then click “Edit” erase everything you have in there and put in @echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit[/quote]

its not the compielr, its any Java .bat file i run. its annoying!

Read full topic

if you right click then click “Edit” erase everything you have in there and put in @echo off if exist "%programfiles%\Java" (call :compile "%programfiles%\Java\") else (goto error) :compile for /D %%x in ("%~1jdk*") do (set p="%%~x\bin\javac.exe") if defined p (%p% -cp . *.java) if defined p (goto end) :error echo You do not have Java installed. Please download it at the site that is about to load. "%programfiles%\Internet Explorer\iexplore.exe" http://java.sun.com/javase/downloads/index.jsp :end echo Finished! pause exit
